intro: Enneatypus nordenskjoeldii, commonly known as the Arctic bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seeds in a capsule. Enneatypus nordenskjoeldii is an important component of Arctic flora, contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat.
